# üé≠  **Step Audio EditX Reference Audio Tips**

1- You can connect any audio from a **Load Audio Core** node directly on **üé≠ Character Voices** and add the transcription manually to make a **zero-shot voice cloning**
 
2- Step Audio EditX like F5 NEEDS an Audio AND a Reference Text. Any character from **üé≠ Character Voices** should have both required files.

1
00:00:01,000 --> 00:00:04,000
Hello! This is unified SRT TTS with character switching.

2
00:00:04,500 --> 00:00:09,500
[Alice] Hi there! I'm Alice speaking with precise timing.

3
00:00:10,000 --> 00:00:14,000
[Bob] And I'm Bob! The audio matches these exact SRT timings.

On Tuesdays, the pigeons held parliament.<emotion:admiration>
[Alice] They debated the ethics of breadcrumbs and the metaphysics of flight. <emotion:surprised>
[Bob] One particularly philosophical pigeon named Thistle believed gravity was just a suggestion.<emotion:confusion>
[Cowboy] He once floated for three minutes straight, fueled by sheer conviction and a gust of rebellious wind.<emotion:admiration>

Hello! This is unified TTS with character switching support.
[Alice] Hi there! I'm Alice speaking with the selected TTS engine.
[Bob] And I'm Bob! This works with any TTS engine.
Back to the main narrator voice for the conclusion.

On Tuesdays, the pigeons held parliament. [pause:3s] They debated the ethics of breadcrumbs and the metaphysics of flight. 
One particularly philosophical pigeon named Thistle believed gravity was just a suggestion.
He once floated for three minutes straight, fueled by sheer conviction and a gust of rebellious wind.

1
00:00:01,000 --> 00:00:04,000
Hello! This is unified SRT TTS with character switching.

2
00:00:04,500 --> 00:00:09,500
[Alice] Hi there! I'm Alice speaking with precise timing.

3
00:00:10,000 --> 00:00:14,000
[Bob] And I'm Bob! The audio matches these exact SRT timings.

# Qwen3-TTS Engine

Alibaba's Qwen3-TTS is a single engine that **automatically selects and downloads the correct model** based on your settings ‚Äî no manual model management needed.

---

## 4 Model Types

### üé≠ CustomVoice ‚Äî Preset Speakers

- 9 built-in multilingual speakers: `Vivian`, `Serena`, `Uncle_Fu`, `Dylan`, `Eric`, `Ryan`, `Aiden`, `Ono_Anna`, `Sohee`
- Available in **0.6B and 1.7B** sizes
- Supports **style instructions** (e.g. *"Speak cheerfully"*, *"Sound professional"*)
- Character switching with `[CharacterName]` auto-maps to one of the 9 preset speakers

### üé® VoiceDesign ‚Äî Create Voices from Text

- Describe a voice and the model generates it instantly
- Example: *"A cheerful young woman with a bright, energetic tone"*
- **1.7B only**
- Supports **style instructions** alongside the voice description
- Generated voices are disk-cached for reuse across sessions

### üé§ Base ‚Äî Zero-Shot Voice Cloning

- Clone any voice from a 3‚Äì30s reference audio clip
- Available in **0.6B and 1.7B** sizes
- ‚ö†Ô∏è **Does NOT support style instructions** ‚Äî instruction field is ignored in this mode

**Two cloning modes:**

     **ICL mode** (default, best quality): uses reference audio **+ reference transcript**. The model reads the transcript as in-context learning to better match the voice. Use the üé≠ Character Voices node ‚Äî it always provides both.
     **X-Vector mode**: uses only the audio to extract a speaker embedding, no transcript needed. Faster but lower quality.

### üî§ ASR ‚Äî Transcription

- Use with the **‚úèÔ∏è Unified ASR Transcribe** node
- Transcribes audio to text with optional forced alignment

---

## Technical Specs

- üåç **10 Languages:** Chinese, English, Japanese, Korean, German, French, Russian, Portuguese, Spanish, Italian
- üìè **2 Model Sizes:** 0.6B and 1.7B (VoiceDesign is 1.7B only)
- ‚ö° **Attention:** `eager`, `flash_attention_2`, `sdpa`, `sage_attn`
- üîß **Generation params:** temperature, top_k, top_p, repetition_penalty
- ‚ö° **torch.compile:** Optional ~1.7x speedup (requires PyTorch 2.10+)

---

## Unified Features

Works with all TTS Audio Suite features: character switching, language switching, pause tags `[pause:1s]`, SRT timing, and Step Audio EditX post-processing.

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Key Limitation: Instructions Only Work on Some Models

| Model | Style Instructions |
| --- | --- |
| CustomVoice | ‚úÖ Supported |
| VoiceDesign | ‚úÖ Supported |
| Base (cloning) | ‚ùå Not supported |
| ASR | ‚ùå N/A |

If you need to control speaking style (emotion, tone, pace), use **CustomVoice** or **VoiceDesign**. Voice cloning does not accept instructions.

---

## Using a Designed Voice Immediately

After generating a voice with the **üé® Voice Designer** node, you have two options:

---

### Option 1 ‚Äî Use as Narrator (same run, no refresh needed)

Connect the `NARRATOR_VOICE` output of the Voice Designer node directly to the `narrator_voice` input of your TTS Text/SRT node.

The designed voice becomes the main narrator voice immediately.

---

### Option 2 ‚Äî Use as a Named Character with `[tags]`

The Voice Designer node saves the voice to the character folder under the name you provide. Once saved, you can reference it in your text using character switching tags:

```
[new_voice_bob] Hello, I am Bob.
[narrator] And I am the narrator.
```

**Limitation:** this requires a refresh of the character folder before the new voice is available. If you run the workflow twice, it works automatically on the second run. For same-run usage, see below.
Annoying orc children female voice, loud and high-pitched but with a monstrous reverb.

Welcome to the TTS Audio Suite. This advanced text-to-speech system brings your stories to life with natural, expressive voices. Whether you're creating audiobooks, videos, or interactive experiences, our technology delivers exceptional quality and versatility. What will you create today?

## Same-Run Character Switching with ‚ôªÔ∏è Refresh Voice Cache

To use a freshly designed voice as a `[character tag]` in the **same workflow run**, use the **‚ôªÔ∏è Refresh Voice Cache** node.

This node refreshes the voice cache mid-run so the new character is available to the TTS node.

### Setup

You need to ensure two things happen in the right order:

1. Voice Designer runs **first** (saves the voice file)
2. Cache refreshes
3. TTS generation runs **after**

To enforce this execution order, connect **two signals** into the Refresh Voice Cache node:

- **Signal 1:** The TTS Engine output (e.g. from the Qwen3-TTS Engine node) ‚Üí this is what your TTS node needs anyway
- **Signal 2:** Any output from the Voice Designer node ‚Üí this forces the designer to run before the cache refresh

Then connect the output of the Refresh Voice Cache node to your TTS node instead of connecting the engine directly.

### Signal Flow

```
[Qwen3 Engine] ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
                                      ‚ñº
[Voice Designer] ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ (any output) ‚ñ∫ [‚ôªÔ∏è Refresh Voice Cache] ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñ∫ [TTS Text Node]
```

This guarantees: Designer runs ‚Üí cache updates ‚Üí TTS generates, all in one run.

On Tuesdays, the pigeons held parliament. [pause:3s] 
[orc_girl] They debated the ethics of breadcrumbs and the metaphysics of flight. One particularly philosophical pigeon named Thistle believed gravity was just a suggestion. He once floated for three minutes straight, fueled by sheer conviction and a gust of rebellious wind.

1 - Load any audio
    2 - If you NEED SRT or timmings, you NEED to have "asr_use_force_aligner" option in the Qwen2 Engine.

## üîß ASR SRT Advanced Options

I know this is overwhelming. Most of these are highly experimental. But it will help a lot in making your SRT output look better. 

You don't need to change anything if you don't want to. It's all optional. The SRT output will use all of these by default in one way or another. 

What you can do here is that you can tinker with each value and adjust it as you like. 

Most of these are post-processing, meaning you won't need to regenerate to test them. Just click run, and it will use the cache previous run apply it immediately.

# **FROM v4 and up!**

Unified nodes:
- üé§ **TTS Text**: Direct text-to-speech module  
- üì∫ **TTS SRT**: Subtitle-compatible TTS output  

These nodes are now **engine-agnostic**, meaning you can plug in **Chatterbox**, **F5**, or future engines seamlessly.

# Qwen3-TTS ‚Äî Performance Optimizations

## torch.compile (~1.7x speedup)

Enable in the Qwen3-TTS Engine node:

- `use_torch_compile` ‚Üí **True**
- `compile_mode` ‚Üí **default** (recommended, works on Windows & Linux)
- `use_cuda_graphs` ‚Üí **False** (redundant when using torch.compile)

**Important:** First generation after enabling is slow (~30-60s compile time). All subsequent generations are fast ‚Äî compiled kernels are cached across sessions.

## Attention Mode

The `attn_implementation` option controls the attention backend:

- `sdpa` ‚Äî good default, works everywhere
- `flash_attention_2` ‚Äî fastest, requires compatible GPU/drivers
- `eager` ‚Äî slowest, most compatible fallback
- `sage_attn` ‚Äî alternative fast attention

## Requirements for torch.compile

- PyTorch **2.10.0+** with CUDA 13.0
- triton **3.6.0+** (triton-windows on Windows)
- Python 3.12 recommended

> ‚ö†Ô∏è `reduce-overhead` and `max-autotune` compile modes **fail on Windows** (cudaMallocAsync error). Use `default`.

---

üìñ **Full setup guide with install commands, troubleshooting, and benchmarks:**
`docs/qwen3_tts_optimizations.md`

On Tuesdays, the pigeons held parliament. [pause:2s] 
[orc_girl] They debated the ethics of breadcrumbs and the metaphysics of flight. One particularly philosophical pigeon named Thistle believed gravity was just a suggestion. He once floated for three minutes straight, fueled by sheer conviction and a gust of rebellious wind.
